title: Understanding Early Detection Tools
text: Early detection tools for anorexia nervosa are designed to identify symptoms and behaviors associated with the disorder. These tools are often used in clinical settings to help healthcare professionals make a preliminary assessment.

title: Familiarize with Common Questionnaires
text: The SCOFF questionnaire and the Eating Disorder Diagnostic Scale (EDDS) are commonly used tools in the early detection of eating disorders. They consist of a series of questions that help identify potential symptoms of anorexia nervosa.

hintAnswer: Sick Control One Fat and Food (SCOFF) questionnaire and the Eating Disorder Diagnostic Scale (EDDS)
title: Identify the Correct Tools
text: Which of the following are tools for early detection of anorexia nervosa?
choices: Sick Control One Fat and Food (SCOFF) questionnaire and the Eating Disorder Diagnostic Scale (EDDS)
